examples: Her arrogance is simply intolerable!
You simply didn't have the heart.
I simply can't tolerate her selfish behavior any longer.
To take your favorite noodle dish to another level, simply sprinkle sesame seeds over it.
To take advantage of this extra bonus offer, simply check the box on your order form.
words.defineEn: used to show that something is the case and nothing more
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để chỉ ra rằng một cái gì đó là trường hợp và không có gì hơn

examples: That holiday cost me a small fortune.
That movie knocked my socks off.
That accident battered up the door of my car.
That shot lost him the championship.
lose that creep!
words.defineEn: so; to such a degree or extent
words.defineVi: Vì thế; ở một mức độ hoặc mức độ như vậy

examples: I absolutely love your shoes.
The cranberry pie at the bakery is absolutely delicious, especially with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
Jenny is absolutely cheesed off with her job.
He was said to be absolutely shattered after losing his job.
Those of you with clear consciences have absolutely nothing to fear.
words.defineEn: used to put an emphasis on a statement
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để nhấn mạnh vào một tuyên bố

examples: Her answer is no.
This policy is no longer an effective means to an end.
Journalists on the spot reported no progress.
They mean no harm.
They mean no harm.
words.defineEn: not at all; not any amount or number or not to any extent
words.defineVi: không có gì; không phải bất kỳ số lượng hoặc số lượng hoặc không ở bất kỳ mức độ nào

examples: The library closes early on Sundays.
She sent the kids to bed early.
Her early research laid the foundation for many important medical discoveries.
Book early and save £50!
For some people, early morning jogging is their cup of tea.
words.defineEn: before the usual or expected time
words.defineVi: trước thời gian thông thường hoặc dự kiến

examples: Lower energy consumption means less pollution.
The whole is sometime less than the sum of its parts.
I could care less about award shows.
Guys automatically become less attractive when they break Priscian's head.
All clothes are in mint condition and less than two years old.
words.defineEn: not so much; to a smaller degree or extent
words.defineVi: không nhiều lắm; đến một mức độ nhỏ hơn hoặc mức độ

examples: Just click the link below.
She had a scar just below her knee from a childhood bike accident.
They are all equally below the salt.
The cliff dropped down over a hundred feet to the sea below.
I know she really wants the promotion, but she really hit me below the belt by telling the boss about my personal problems.
words.defineEn: in a lower level, position, or place
words.defineVi: ở cấp độ thấp hơn, vị trí hoặc địa điểm

examples: Things certainly move fast in the blogosphere.
He certainly earned his place in the sun.
Kramer has certainly won the respect of his peers.
I certainly learned my lesson about buying something from a stranger online.
America is certainly bigger than the sum of its parts.
words.defineEn: with no doubt
words.defineVi: không có nghi ngờ

examples: The heat was really on at work.
That hot guy had a good head on his shoulders.
The children enjoyed a refreshing slice of watermelon on a hot summer day.
On the credit side, the restaurant offers a wide range of choices.
Our company puts the emphasis on quality.
words.defineEn: used to indicate that something continues and does not stop
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để chỉ ra rằng một cái gì đó tiếp tục và không dừng lại

examples: Perhaps it had something to do with their drink.
Perhaps we should consider the flip side of the coin : there should be no expenditure without representation.
I know there's a lot to discuss, but perhaps we should take a break for now.
The chances of Francis eventually becoming manager of England are perhaps higher.
Next week perhaps I’ll find myself wearing a different hat.
words.defineEn: used to express possibility or to show one's uncertainty about something
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để thể hiện khả năng hoặc để thể hiện sự không chắc chắn của một người về điều gì đó

examples: The policeman hammered home the dangers of drinking and driving.
My son is coming home soon.
The forest is home to a diverse range of plant and animal species.
I pressed the issue home to them.
To hit a home run.
words.defineEn: to, at, or toward the place where one lives
words.defineVi: đến, tại, hoặc hướng tới nơi mà một người sống

examples: These powers were eventually passed to municipalities.
The rumors eventually reached the President.
She eventually became a victim of her own success.
Eventually, he came face to face with discrimination again.
If you keep working so hard, the stress will eventually take its toll.
words.defineEn: after or at the end of a series of events or a long time
words.defineVi: sau hoặc khi kết thúc một chuỗi sự kiện hoặc một thời gian dài

examples: Snails that aren’t infected reproduce super quickly.
Things just slip their minds super easily.
Two, turn the volume down, super easy.
The Chinese auto market is super competitive.
These approaches are super effective.
words.defineEn: extremely and to an excessive extent
words.defineVi: cực kỳ và đến một mức độ quá mức

examples: My mind went totally blank.
His explanation is totally full of prunes and doesn't answer the question at all.
As so often happened, Peter, Tommy and Henry had totally lost sight of their real objective.
I'm sorry I didn't call you back sooner, it totally slipped my mind.
I totally blew my cover when I stupidly wore my school jacket to steal the other team's mascot.
words.defineEn: to the full amount or degree
words.defineVi: đến toàn bộ số lượng hoặc mức độ

examples: This disaster comes hard on the heels of last week’s train crash.
The kids always work hard at school.
For Walter, disaster followed hard on the heels of his initial success.
Life on the road can be very hard.
She worked hard toward her degree.
words.defineEn: with a lot of difficulty or effort
words.defineVi: với rất nhiều khó khăn hoặc nỗ lực

examples: After that, things moved forward at lightning speed.
We'll take the matter forward at our next meeting.
My children look forward to receiving gifts during the winter holidays.
He took a big step forward to start his new adventure.
He leaned forward to take her hand.
words.defineEn: to or toward the front
words.defineVi: đến hoặc về phía trước

examples: Ok, we can meet at the park instead.
My friend's last name is difficult to pronounce, so she often uses a nickname instead.
Instead, it looked like the right hand didn't know what the left hand was doing.
I wanted to speak to the manager but I got his secretary instead.
He prefers to lift weights and do strength training instead.
words.defineEn: as a substitute, alternative, or equivalent
words.defineVi: như một sự thay thế, thay thế, hoặc tương đương

examples: The dog has gone inside.
She knows the business inside out.
He accidentally put his underwear on inside out.
A lot has happened inside these four walls.
She reached inside her bag for a pen.
words.defineEn: in or into a room or building; within a building
words.defineVi: trong hoặc vào một căn phòng hoặc tòa nhà; trong một tòa nhà

examples: Next add the flour.
The school semester starts next month.
Next year sees the centenary of Saint-Saëns' death.
The theatre company has several new productions in the pipeline for next season.
Our next class will take the form of a debate.
words.defineEn: immediately after or afterward
words.defineVi: ngay sau đó hoặc sau đó

examples: Accidents like this happen all the time.
Martin was lying all the time.’
It’s difficult to do housework with the children under my feet all the time.
She claims that she rubs shoulders with royalty all the time.
Tommy, you seem to show up a day late and a dollar short all the time.
words.defineEn: constantly or continuously
words.defineVi: liên tục hoặc liên tục

examples: That kick of yours could have easily made mincemeat of my face.
Ciphers are easily broken by the new wonder machines.
Memorizing important dates in history came easily to him in school.
He picked up the new language easily by listening to podcasts.
Booksellers should easily be able to move this biography of Lincoln.
words.defineEn: with no problem or difficulty
words.defineVi: không có vấn đề hoặc khó khăn

examples: He took up the reins of government immediately after the coup.
I immediately ordered a plate of Mediterranean busiate, which was prepared with artichoke and feta.
See your doctor immediately if you pass any blood.
She's wanted immediately in the director's office.
They hit it off immediately when they met at the party.
words.defineEn: in a way that is instant and involves no delay
words.defineVi: theo cách đó là ngay lập tức và không có sự chậm trễ

examples: This last point, it seems to me, is particularly important.
Adventure expeditions are growing in popularity, particularly among older Americans with money to burn.
The nurse joked that doctors make the worst patients, after a particularly difficult interaction with a physician who was reluctant to follow medical advice.
It doesn't particularly excite her.
I didn't particularly like the job - it was just a means to an end.
words.defineEn: used to indicate that something specifically refers or applies to one individual, thing, or situation
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để chỉ ra rằng một cái gì đó đề cập cụ thể hoặc áp dụng cho một cá nhân, sự vật hoặc tình huống

examples: Somewhere within, a harp was playing.
I know it's here somewhere!
Let's go somewhere where we can talk to our hearts' content.
And that's fair enough, that somebody brings them to book somewhere.
The book I'm looking for should lie somewhere on this bookshelf.
words.defineEn: in, at, or to some unspecified place
words.defineVi: trong, tại, hoặc đến một số nơi không xác định

examples: Cristina literally takes the mick out of everyone.
We literally shopped until we dropped.
I literally would never have considered giving writing a shot without your example and encouragement.
I was being sarcastic but you took my comment literally.
He literally used the oldest trick in the book and still won.
words.defineEn: used for putting emphasis on something that seems surprising but is true
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để nhấn mạnh vào một cái gì đó có vẻ đáng ngạc nhiên nhưng là sự thật
